quotes: Got the Caesar salad, and it was fantastic
I ordered their Chicken Caesar salad

quotes: Today the kale was really hard, I had a stalk of lettuce in my no prob cobb which I don't even think comes with lettuce and I don't know why it doesn't taste the same but it got bad enough I tried sweetgreen but hated it and ended up back here again and this is the experience

quotes: Will need to come back and try the Verde Bowl sometime

quotes: Had a green smoothie,  the service,  atmosphere and pricing were all excellent

topProducts.name: Açaí Bowl
topProducts.description: A menu item a customer was disappointed they could not get because the store locked its doors 10 minutes before closing.
quotes: they locked the doors 10 minutes before they actually closed and i was bummed i couldn’t get my açaí bowl :(

Whereas the food, I was highly disappointed… I’ve ordered the dragon açaí bowl and received a half empty container of açaí… I’ve never had this happen to me before and I get açaí often so this was very upsetting to see

topProducts.name: Fiesta Bowl
topProducts.description: A bowl that was mentioned by name in a review without further description.
quotes: Fiesta bowl or Cobb are my favorites
I’ve tried the Fiesta Bowl and the Bold Buffalo Bowl which were both solid

highlightedReviews.author: Suni Zmich
highlightedReviews.text: I finally went to Crisp & Green after resisting for 1.5 years. My rationale: how can any restaurant that sounds healthy be delicious? I’m sure it has something to do with my childhood filled with tasteless “healthy” meals of bran fiber and iceberg lettuce. On Tuesday of last week, I finally entered the premises due to time constraints and the convenient proximity to my condo. I was warmly welcomed and shown the “HOW TOs” by an enthusiastic smiley staff member. The Seoul Bowl filled my stomach and spirit with unforeseen delight. I went back on Thursday to recreate the experience with a friend and was not disappointed. The mushrooms were perfectly marinated, changing the texture to a plump chew. The tofu was as good as any chicken I have ever tasted. When I asked how the tofu was prepared, I learned that it was bathed in some kind of dreamy citrusy ginger magic. The combination of the spicy bibimbap & cashew dressing harmoniously brought all of the fresh ingredients together. I loved the balance of sweet and savory in this dish (echoes of many Korean recipes), with the vegetable crunchiness punctuating the creaminess. I left satiated and with a newly formed respect for healthy food.

highlightedReviews.author: Drew Pesall
highlightedReviews.text:
A pretty standard grain bowl & salad place. I know some people have had issues with portion sizes when ordering for delivery, but I’ve always eaten in person and they’ve always filled up my bowl. Even then, it’s not cheap, but the food is solid and there’s many healthy options if that’s what you’re in the market for.

I’ve tried the Fiesta Bowl and the Bold Buffalo Bowl which were both solid. Nothing really to write home around here but if salad/grain bowls are your thing or you want a healthier option it’s absolutely worth a visit.

highlightedReviews.author: Heike L.
highlightedReviews.text:
Hier gibt es Bowls, Salate und Wraps. Sehr freundlicher Service. Der Laden ist hübsch eingerichtet,  und sehr gepflegt. Fast Food der besonderen Art.
Interessante Zutaten,  reichhaltig und lecker.
Wir hatten 2 verschiedene Bowls, die beide frisch zubereitet wurden.
Der einzige Nachteil ist,  dass es nur Einweggeschirr und Besteck gibt.

highlightedReviews.author: VK
highlightedReviews.text: Great salads and bowls!  We were looking for a healthy but tasty lunch and these guys have it!  They put your food together right in front of you making sure the ingredients were exactly what you want!  Super!

highlightedReviews.author: Kyrsten Larson
highlightedReviews.text: I ordered an Imagine Dragon Fruit Bowl and it was handed to me while I was still in the line. The lady in front of me was having issues with her gift card and the person working the register kept arguing with her so my smoothie bowl was melting as I stood there waiting to pay. Once I got to eat it, though, it was pretty good. I asked for strawberries instead of blueberries which was nice they let me do that. I also appreciated that the bowl was gluten free. I wish the smoothie part would have been a little more flavorful. Overall I would eat there again and order something different.

highlightedReviews.author: Clara Montbriand
highlightedReviews.text:
Such friendly staff. Took time to explain my options. Some people there have the  nicest smiles, which is always so welcome. I witnessed  some customers and door dash people being a tad bit rude (not acceptable people) and the staff remained professional at all times. Excellent job management!
The decoration is pretty and not busy. Plenty of light and very clean.

Would benefit from a sign at the beginning of the line informing people that they don’t take cash. I see the no cash as a good way to keep employees safe and to ensure more sanitary standards. I will be coming back!

highlightedReviews.author: Jonathon Krouth
highlightedReviews.text: A lovely place. Very clean. Workers were very attentive and engaged. Lots of fresh options. Got the Caesar salad, and it was fantastic! Will need to come back and try the Verde Bowl sometime.

highlightedReviews.author: Justin Time
highlightedReviews.text: The food was delicious but pretty expensive. The Bold & the Buffalo is one of my all-time favorite salads!

highlightedReviews.author: Pete Boisclair
highlightedReviews.text: Very friendly and polite staff here, with an extremely clean restaurant! It was my first time trying a Crisp and Green and the C’est La Viche salad did not disappoint! I would definitely go back here.

highlightedReviews.author: Lee Witte
highlightedReviews.text: Service was fast, but I just can't give more stars when it's order and pay at the assembly line. Food was fresh and the facility was clean. If there is a washroom here, it's hidden. Healthy options but has a fast, subway like vibe.
